summary: Email correspondence between defense attorney Christian Everdell and a federal prosecutor regarding trial logistics for the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The email discusses the anticipated length of trial and scheduling for a Rule 412/Daubert hearing.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Defense attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell, corresponding with prosecutors about trial logistics and hearing scheduling.

events.title: Potential Rule 412/Daubert Hearing
events.description: The defense indicates availability for a Rule 412/Daubert hearing on this date.

events.title: Preferred Rule 412/Daubert Hearing
events.description: The defense indicates a preference for holding the Rule 412/Daubert hearing on this date.

keyFacts: The defense team for Ghislaine Maxwell maintained a 6-week estimate for the trial length as of November 2021.
The government's estimated case-in-chief was 3-4 weeks.
The parties were coordinating to schedule a Rule 412/Daubert hearing, with the defense preferring November 10, 2021.
The correspondence shows ongoing pre-trial preparations and coordination between the defense and prosecution.
